intro: Pithecoctenium echinatum f. grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered hibiscus, is a variant of the hibiscus family (Malvaceae) characterized by its showy, large, trumpet-shaped flowers. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in warm, humid climates. The plant features palmate leaves with lobed margins and produces vibrant pink to red flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various soil types. The species is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
